  16. /* A table of all code fragments (main program and dynlinked modules) */

  18. #ifndef CAML_CODEFRAG_H
  19. ‌#define CAML_CODEFRAG_H

  21. #ifdef CAML_INTERNALS

  23. #include "platform.h"

  25. ‌enum digest_status {
  26.   DIGEST_LATER,    /* computed on demand */
  27.   DIGEST_NOW,      /* computed by caml_register_code_fragment */
  28.   DIGEST_PROVIDED, /* passed by caller of caml_register_code_fragment */
  29.   DIGEST_IGNORE    /* this code fragment is private and cannot be
  30.                       identified by its digest */
  31. };

  33. ‌struct code_fragment {
  34.   char *code_start;
  35.   char *code_end;
  36.   int fragnum;
  37.   enum digest_status digest_status;
  38.   unsigned char digest[16];
  39.   /* the digest is obtained by hashing
  40.      the bytes between [code_start] and [code_end]. */
  41.   caml_plat_mutex mutex;
  42.   /* [mutex] protects the fields [digest_status] and [digest],
  43.      which may be written to when computing a digest
  44.      on-demand (DIGEST_LATER) and thus require synchronization. */
  45. };

  47. /* Initialise codefrag. This must be done before any of the other
  48.    operations in codefrag. */
  49. void caml_init_codefrag(void);

  51. /* Register a code fragment for addresses [start] (included)
  52.    to [end] (excluded).  This range of addresses is assumed
  53.    disjoint from all currently-registered code fragments.

  55.    [digest_kind] explains what digest is to be associated to the code
  56.    fragment.  If [digest_kind == DIGEST_PROVIDED], the [opt_digest]
  57.    parameter points to the 16-byte digest of the code.
  58.    For all other values of [digest_kind], [opt_digest] is ignored
  59.    and should be [NULL].

  61.    The returned integer is the fragment number (fragnum) associated
  62.    with the new code fragment. */
  63. extern int caml_register_code_fragment(char * start, char * end,
  64.                                        enum digest_status digest_kind,
  65.                                        unsigned char * opt_digest);

  67. /* Un-register a code fragment. */
  68. extern void caml_remove_code_fragment(struct code_fragment * cf);

  70. /* Find the code fragment whose range of addresses contains [pc].
  71.    Returns NULL if none exists. */
  72. extern struct code_fragment * caml_find_code_fragment_by_pc(char *pc);

  74. /* Find the code fragment whose fragment number is [fragnum].
  75.    Returns NULL if none exists. */
  76. extern struct code_fragment * caml_find_code_fragment_by_num(int fragnum);

  78. /* Find the code fragment whose digest is equal to the given digest.
  79.    Returns NULL if none exists. */
  80. extern struct code_fragment *
  81.    caml_find_code_fragment_by_digest(unsigned char digest[16]);

  83. /* Return the digest of the given code fragment.
  84.    If the code fragment was registered in [DIGEST_LATER] mode
  85.    and if the digest was not computed yet, it is obtained by hashing
  86.    the bytes between [code_start] and [code_end].
  87.    Returns NULL if the code fragment was registered with [DIGEST_IGNORE]. */
  88. extern unsigned char * caml_digest_of_code_fragment(struct code_fragment *);

  90. /* Cleans up (and frees) removed code fragments. Must be called from a stop the
  91.    world pause by only a single thread. */
  92. extern void caml_code_fragment_cleanup(void);

  94. #endif

  96. #endif
